content: Visual Page Segmentation & MSN Mobile SEO By: Rand Fishkin February 1, 2005 The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Table of Contents Copied! By: Rand Fishkin February 1, 2005 Visual Page Segmentation & MSN Mobile SEO The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. An incredible research paper from Microsoft highlights the advancements in search engine link detection technology. The paper, VIPS: a Vision-based Page Segmentation Algorithm - discusses the use of page segmentation through a relatively simple algorithm that allows search engines to deduce which sections of a page are content, navigation, advertising, etc. and then raise or lower the impact of links from certain blocks. A visual example is included below: In addition, MSN announced their massive ad blitz for the upcoming Superbowl, NCAA finals & spring season. They hope to hit 90% of all US households with ads about their new search engine services (which was officially released today). With Microsoft already the number 3 share in the search market and their destiny to grow larger, it's imperative that we as SEOs think about MSn when optimizing sites. Several good threads on the subject already exist: WMW - MSN Optimization SEOChat - MSN Ranking Factors List SEW - SEO for MSN Copied! Back to Top
